Cuerpo: I have had success using them for such disparate tasks as modeling how children acquire words, studying how lobsters chew, and nonlinear data compression. My research group, Gary and Eric's Unbelievable Research Unit or GEURU (pronounced like "neuron", shortened) for short, meets weekly to present our work to one another. Here's my vitae (sorry, postscript only) (45K) Selected publications: Daniel S. Clouse and Garrison W. Cottrell (1996) Discrete Multi-Dimensional scaling.
